Description: Possible cast model of sistrum in copper alloy, maybe a votive offering; fluted thin handle with globular partly ribbed projection at one end and square base with four prongs ribbed on the outside, two of which are connected with a linking bar; one of the linking bars is completely broken off; upper part missing; corroded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Even though the MFA database lists the Scarab Factory as the findspot, the EEF list seems to list this object separately from those objects found in the Scarab Factory. Caution is therefore required for the specific findspot of this piece and, subsequently, its dating should not be only limited to the activity of the Scarab Factory in the 26th dynasty.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MC.15) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
